Text:
Ten million dollars
for the missile chip.
Not a plan, but the chip itself.

My clients have requested it.

Sounds like your clients want to build
a missile that can't be detected by radar.
I don't ask questions, Mr. Beaupre,

MAN: Uh, that's, uh-- (clears throat)
That's what you asked for.

If that goes in a missile,

Uh, look. I got a plane to catch.

possibly, probably

Consider this your payment.

-Thank you.

They're all old.

It's not my fault you can't find

Okay, fine. One hour.

and taking care of my sick child,

Did you tell Charlie

What about the Family Leave Act?

I just have to go in

I'll be gone an hour

I called Mrs. Hess and told her

You called Mrs. Hess?

She said if anything comes up,

She wasn't happy about it, but--

She could get tanked up

and come over

-Oh, don't be ridiculous.
-What do I do if there's a tornado?
I hear it's deadly in old folks.

I don't think that's a problem

Why not?
Nobody's home during the day.

I'm only eight,
and I figured that out.

Don't you think a grown-up crook

This is a very safe neighborhood.

There's only one road

The doors will be locked.
You have all my numbers.

-I'll be home as soon as I can.
-But, Mom!

What about dragons,

the living dead

Alex, I can't help you there.

Only you can control

My mom just had to run out

Can I have your address, please?

The guy isn't at my house.
He's at the Stephans'.

-There's a burglar in the Stephans' house!
-What?
I saw him with my telescope.

There's a woman with a dog
and a gray van...
and a man in running clothes.

I didn't recognize anybody
but the dog.

He looked just like Johnny Allen's dog.
So I called the police.

The burglar alarm
was on and working.
There was no one in the house.

It doesn't appear that
anything's been taken.

I don't know
what your boy saw, but...
there wasn't a person in that house.

I-I'm very sorry about this.
My son's been home with the chicken pox,

and I just had to run to work
to pick up some papers.

I'm completely strapped.
I don't normally do this.

Son, false alarms
are no joking matter.

It wasn't a false alarm.
There was a guy in the house.

He had two lookouts

You might want to remind him

We gave him a police set
for Christmas.

Not this Christmas,
but last Christmas.

A badge and a hat and a whistle.
He took it very seriously.

He went around the house
arresting relatives for various crimes.
Oh, you know, not real crimes.

Just sort of leaving the toilet
seat up and snoring and--
Absolutely. I will. Yes. Thank you.
You get in that bed, young man.

Excuse me, but I saw a man
in Karen Stephans' bedroom.
A white male, a little older than Dad,

and he was wearing
butt-inspection gloves.

I have warned you
about that telescope.
You look through it long enough,

you're gonna start seeing things,
whether or not they're there.

I guess you have to be 35
before anyone around here listens to you.
Don't get smart with me, Alex.

Sick or not,
I am very angry with you.

You have caused
a lot of trouble today.

Dad and I have to replace
a door at the Stephans'.

Do you think
we're happy about that?

They were ticketed
under known aliases...

but didn't board
the Hong Kong flight.

I believe they're still in the U.S.,
but beyond that...
we've got to find that chip.

ALICE: What went wrong
with the burglar alarm?

ALICE: Cars came and went.
The mailman came by.

We could have a watcher

-It could be anybody.

Oh, shoot. Your mom's not back yet.

Mrs. Hess is home.
You'll be fine, okay?

My beeper number's

Second button.

All right.

apologize to the chief
